meanings.sent1: The malposition of the chair made it uncomfortable to sit on.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noticed a malposition of the baby during the ultrasound.
meanings.sent3: The malposition of the traffic cone on the playground caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her malposition in the dance group made her stand out in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The malposition of the puzzle piece made it impossible to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: To place in an improper position
meanings.sent1: Please do not malposition the books on the shelf, keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally malpositioned the vase on the table, causing it to fall.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly malpositioned the hat on her dog's head for a funny photo.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind malpositioned the umbrella, turning it inside out.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully malpositioned the elements in the painting to create a sense of imbalance.
